Overall this draft shows the right four-line structure and a plausible regime/scenario framing, but it falls short on the exact format, explicit probabilities, and tight, first-principles linkage. Key fixes: (1) enforce the required four-line format with exact fields and fill in Probability % for each line; anchor probabilities to the material’s language (e.g., “moderate confidence path” or explicit regime odds) and attach precise IDs after facts; use ranges rather than vague levels where the sources don’t give a single number. (2) Reorder and align lines so two Up lines and two Down lines map to a clean cause–effect chain: Baseline/Escalation as Up or Down with clear catalysts, and Deregulation/Geopolitics as the other pair, ensuring each line states a concrete driver, a watch item, and a numeric focal point. (3) Tighten first-principles grounding: start from the five pillars (tariff regime, real-rate/policy reaction, productivity/supply-chain reconfiguration, cross-border finance, governance) and show how each line’s driver propagates to prices, margins, or capital reallocation, citing Adyen (QRX2HD4X0), Intel‑CHIPS governance (5M9M1KACF), Japan anti-dumping (2SJORBV6H), and the tariff signals (RHFWI02JT; Scraped Source 2) where relevant. (4) Quantification and specificity: replace generic phrases with concrete numbers where available (15% EU tariff; 1.8% near-term lift; 18.6% import burden; Adyen H1-2025 metrics) and attach citations after each numeric claim (e.g., “15% broad EU tariff (RHFWI02JT)”; “1.8% lift, 18.6% tariff burden (Scraped Source 2)”; “Adyen H1 2025 net revenue €1,093.5m, +20% YoY (QRX2HD4X0)”). (5) Outlook/Swing-Trade plan: since the material is macro/regime-focused and not a single tradable asset, present the required Outlook as a single, concise line if you’re not conditioning on a tradable asset; otherwise, convert to a Swing Trade line for a liquid instrument if preferred and specify entry/stop/target and risk metrics with sources. (6) Citations: ensure every factual number has an in-text ID, and avoid piling sources on non-numeric claims; ensure coverage of critical sources (RHFWI02JT; Scraped Source 2/3; QRX2HD4X0; 2SJORBV6H; 5M9M1KACF; 9W8ZUIBDY; WLXM1819K; AJTHKYXQ3; DGG6HXUFZ; VCZKKPORO; etc.) and reconcile any conflicts (e.g., Baseline tariff persistence vs Geopolitics shocks) within the four lines.
